parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Apparently a primary verb; which uses dremo drem'-o as alternate in certain tenses; to run or walk hastily.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To interrupt, hinder. From en and kopto; to cut into, i.e. impede, detain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
